What is the ALF Appliance? #The ALF is a lightweight, removable dental appliance designed to gently guide the development and alignment of the jaw and facial structures. Unlike traditional orthodontic approaches that focus primarily on straightening teeth, the ALF works with the body’s natural growth patterns to address underlying structural and functional issues.

As the body shifts to accommodate a growing baby, areas of tension and restriction can develop — contributing to discomfort and affecting overall function.
Dr. Ventimiglia’s gentle, hands-on approach supports the body through these changes, helping to maintain comfort and optimal function.

What is osteopathic manipulative medicine? #Osteopathic manipulative medicine (OMM) is a hands-on approach to diagnosis and treatment. An osteopathic physician uses their hands to identify areas of restriction, tension, or imbalance in the body’s structure — and then uses gentle techniques to help the body restore itself to better function.
What is the difference between a D.O. and an M.D.? #Both D.O.s (Doctors of Osteopathic Medicine) and M.D.s (Medical Doctors) are fully licensed physicians who can diagnose, treat, prescribe medication, and perform surgery. D.O.s receive additional training in osteopathic manipulative medicine, which gives them a hands-on approach to evaluating and treating the musculoskeletal system.
How is OMM different from chiropractic care? # [PLACEHOLDER] Dr. V to answer in her own words — this is one of the most common questions patients ask.
While both involve hands-on treatment, osteopathic physicians complete medical school and residency training, giving them a broader medical perspective. OMM considers the whole body — not just the spine — and uses a variety of gentle techniques tailored to each patient.

content:
Welcome to the osteopathic practice of Melissa Ventimiglia, D.O.
Dr. Ventimiglia specializes in osteopathic manipulative medicine (OMM), serving the greater New York City area. With years of experience, she treats everyone from newborns to the elderly using gentle, hands-on techniques that support the body’s natural ability to heal.
Why Osteopathy #Structure affects function. Anatomy affects physiology. The human body is a complex organism in which everything — bones, muscles, nerves, blood and lymphatic vessels, fascia and fluid — is all one.
The body grows, it self-regulates, it heals. These very subtle forces and motions are continuous, just as respiration, and are palpable to the osteopathic medical physician. If these life processes are impaired by trauma, illness, habit, or poor adaptation, physiology — and thereby function — will not be optimal.
The osteopathic medical physician can feel these disruptions (somatic dysfunction) and gently, with manipulation, assist the patient in reorganizing their physiology to promote health.
If you have any questions, please call or email — Dr. Ventimiglia is always happy to discuss how osteopathy can apply to your situation.
